de.jcommandlineparser
Interface Strategy

public interface Strategy

The Strategy interface represents a parsing strategy, meaning the parsing logic.
An implementation of Strategy expects the command line String to have a certain format, that is known to the Strategy implementation:

key1=value2 key2=value2
would be such a simple format.

Author:
bananenkasper
See Also:
AbstractOption

Method Detail

parse

java.lang.String[] parse(java.lang.String[] args1,
                         java.util.Set<AbstractOption<?>> args2)
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                NoValueExeption,
                                NoKeyException
Parameters:
args1 - Command line arguments, that will be parsed.
args2 - A list of options, for which will be parsed.
Returns:
Single String, that contains all remaining arguments, that could not be recognized by this Strategy
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if parsing a certain value has failed. e.g. Integer.parseint("foo");
NoValueExeption - if no value is set for option.
NoKeyException
See Also:
